subject: Re: [junit] Junit and Ant classpath problem
msgSnippet: ... The only solution to that is to not put optional.jar there either (and to include it into your  as well).
messageBody:
On Thu, 17 Oct 2002, <fee@...> wrote:

> Basically I want to use the <classpath> tag and avoid putting the
> junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib directory.

The only solution to that is to not put optional.jar there either (and
to include it into your <classpath> as well).

<http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/faq.html#delegating-classloader> is what
you are looking for if you want more details.

Stefan
